availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Mitchell Quinton (Mercer County, Kentucky, carpenter)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, carpenter. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Woods Quinton on April 23, 1846 in Pulaski County, Kentucky. Married to Elizabeth Woods on September 20, 1851 in Pulaski County. Married to Sarah Quinton. Father of John F. Quinton. Married to America Badgeley Quinton on December 11, 1856 in Casey County, Kentucky. Father of Harry F. Quinton and Robert W. Quinton. Painter in Boyle County, Kentucky in 1850. Carpenter in Mercer County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 19th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a private from November 1, 1861 to August 9, 1862.
